subject: Re: Update on intelligent Senior QS Font.
msgSnippet: I use a Mac, and all of the QA fonts I have downloaded from the forum so far suffer from a similar problem: the ooze sound is much thinner/lighter than the
messageBody:
I use a Mac, and all of the QA fonts I have downloaded from the forum so far suffer
from a similar problem: the "ooze" sound is much thinner/lighter than the other
characters. With the default anti-aliasing on Mac OS X and/or in printing it often
seems to disappear next to the other characters. Making it boldface often fixes the
problem, but not always and it is a pain in any case.

I have seen this with jerome, junior, kwikskript, kingsley and QS2 block. The
problems aren't noticeable when I use the (Win 98) PC at work.

oliver

I use a Mac, and all of the QA fonts I have downloaded from the forum so far suffer 
from a similar problem: the "ooze" sound is much thinner/lighter than the other 
characters.  With the default anti-aliasing on Mac OS X and/or in printing it often 
seems to disappear next to the other characters.  Making it boldface often fixes the 
problem, but not always and it is a pain in any case.

I have seen this with jerome, junior, kwikskript, kingsley and QS2 block.  The 
problems aren't noticeable when I use the (Win 98) PC at work.

oliver
